8 TABLE

Default <table> styles.

8.1 Base

Note that all heading sizes are aliased via the .hN classes. So if you would like your <h6> to look like an <h1> then simply add the class .h1

Lorem Ipsum Dolor Sit
Sit Dolor 03.788 Lorem
Dolor 32.210 Lorem Lorem
Dolor 47.797 Lorem Lorem
Sit Dolor 09.640 Lorem
Dolor 12.117 Lorem Lorem
.table--striped

Applies odd/even "striped" effect to tables

Lorem Ipsum Dolor Sit
Sit Dolor 03.788 Lorem
Dolor 32.210 Lorem Lorem
Dolor 47.797 Lorem Lorem
Sit Dolor 09.640 Lorem
Dolor 12.117 Lorem Lorem 
<table class="{$modifiers}">
  <thead>
      <tr>
          <th>Lorem</th>
          <th>Ipsum</th>
          <th>Dolor</th>
          <th>Sit</th>
      </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
      <tr>
          <th>Sit</th>
          <td>Dolor</td>
          <td>03.788</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
          <td>Dolor</td>
          <td>32.210</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
          <td>Dolor</td>
          <td>47.797</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
          <th>Sit</th>
          <td>Dolor</td>
          <td>09.640</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
          <td>Dolor</td>
          <td>12.117</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
          <td>Lorem</td>
      </tr>
 </tbody>
</table>
